intro: Nestlera biennis, commonly known as the annual nestlera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
